text: I think the name Tatsumairi is a typo, and that it was always called Tazmily Village. The Japanese pronunciation is ‚ÄúTazumili‚Äù, and if you add just an A in between the ‚Äúm‚Äù and the ‚Äúi‚Äù, it becomes ‚ÄúTazumaili‚Äù, hence, Tatsumairi.

text: The graphics look pretty good for the N64! Too bad the DD did so poorly and we lost this title. Oh well, the version that came out on the GBA 16 years later is my favorite game of all time! ^^ Also, I read that the N64DD version was supposed to be A LOT darker and the ending was supposedly going to be more obscure. Can't remember where though...Also, the fan made sequel MOTHER 4 comes out this Winter! :D
author: Delfino224

text:
I love Earthbound. One of my favorite games of all time. When I heard about Mother 3, I just had to play it. So I did. Got near the end, then my saved game bugged up. Had to start from scratch. On the second attempt, maybe halfway through, saved game messed up again. Had to restart from the beginning ALL over again. So frustrating...

It's been a year or two since my last try. I like the game, but it doesn't feel anywhere near as good as Earthbound, and that's probably why I haven't pushed to beat it. That and the saved game bullshit I've dealt with thus far. Bummer for me, huh?

author: Imran Khan

text: Sorry in advance for reopening the wound of never being able to play this game, eventhough we did get the mostly equivalent title on the GBA. It's interesting to note that Keichii Suzuki (composer of Earthbound) is the one who actually composed this theme for the N64, as it's also in Mother 3 with its soundtrack composed by Shogo Sakai. It's one of my favorite themes in Mother 3 so I'm not surprised it was originally Suzuki's work.

author: Avery Jenson

text: I know this is an old comment, but I would like to know where the bit about Mr. Suzuki composing this theme came from. IIRC, Itoi said that neither Suzuki or Hirokazu Tanaka could compose music for MOTHER 3 due to them not willing to commit to the project full-time, especially given to the dynamic, almost chaotic nature of the game's stretched development at the time (MOTHER 2's development troubles are almost nothing compared to M3's, IMO).
author: OKeijiDragon
